dragon_parts.name: Dragon Meat
dragon_parts.yield: Meat in kg based on size
dragon_parts.notes: Counts as a luxury ingredient; sells at full value even when in Sell mode.

dragon_parts.name: Blood
dragon_parts.yield: Blood in liters based on size
dragon_parts.notes: Used in potions, inks, and rituals.

dragon_parts.name: Teeth
dragon_parts.notes: Commonly carved into talismans or jewelry.

dragon_parts.name: Claws
dragon_parts.notes: Excellent for light weaponry and fetishes.

dragon_parts.name: Scales
dragon_parts.failure: Sloppy materials: -1 to crafted item modifier and rarity

dragon_parts.name: Bones
dragon_parts.failure: Sloppy materials: -1 to crafted item modifier and rarity

dragon_parts.name: Horns/Spines
dragon_parts.failure: Sloppy materials: -1 to crafted item modifier and rarity

dragon_parts.name: Wings
dragon_parts.failure: Sloppy materials: -1 to crafted item modifier and rarity

dragon_parts.name: Draconis Fundamentum
dragon_parts.failure: Explosion of elemental energy; nearby creatures may take heavy damage.

dragon_parts.name: Heart
dragon_parts.failure: Dragon's Disease; mishandling may curse the harvester.

standard_parts.name: Meat
standard_parts.yield: Meat in kg based on size

standard_parts.name: Hide / Bones
standard_parts.yield: Hide or bones for 1 piece of armor or 1–2 weapons
standard_parts.failure: Sloppy materials: -1 to crafted item modifier and rarity

standard_parts.name: Eyestalks
standard_parts.failure_description: Accidental Ray Discharge: A clumsy extraction triggers a residual magical spasm. The harvester must succeed on a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw or be struck by a random Beholder eye ray from the surviving stalks.

standard_parts.name: Petrifying Eye
standard_parts.failure_description: Sloppy removal punctures the ocular fluid; the eye loses its magical properties and cannot be used to craft oils for curing petrification.

standard_parts.name: Displacer Tentacle
standard_parts.failure_description: The delicate light-bending organ within the tentacle is severed incorrectly, resulting in a 'sloppy' material that imposes a -1 penalty to any crafted item's rarity or modifiers.

standard_parts.name: Death Eye
standard_parts.failure_description: The eye releases a final burst of necrotic energy. The harvester must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw or take 36 (8d8) necrotic damage as if targeted by the creature's Death Ray.

standard_parts.name: Adhesive Filament
standard_parts.failure_description: The filament adheres to the harvester's tools and tangles into a useless knot, becoming magically inert and losing its structural integrity.

standard_parts.name: Acidic Skin Gland
standard_parts.failure_description: The gland ruptures during harvesting, drenching the harvester in corrosive slime and dealing 5 (1d10) acid damage.

fiend_parts.name: Vial of Demon Ichor
fiend_parts.failure_description: The ichor is contaminated with mundane fluids or the vial shatters during collection, rendering the substance magically inert.

fiend_parts.name: Barbed Devil Stinger
fiend_parts.notes: Can be used as a +1 dagger that deals an additional 1d6 fire damage, though it breaks on a natural 1.
fiend_parts.failure_description: The stinger breaks during extraction, becoming too brittle to use as a weapon.

fiend_parts.name: Succubus/Incubus Pheromone Gland
fiend_parts.notes: Can be brewed into a Philter of Love or used to gain advantage on a single Persuasion check.
fiend_parts.failure_description: The gland ruptures, releasing its contents and affecting the harvester with its effects.

fiend_parts.name: Nightmare Mane
fiend_parts.notes: The hair remains hot to the touch. It can be woven into a "Fire-Resistant Lariat" that deals 1d4 fire damage to anyone restrained by it.
fiend_parts.failure_description: The mane loses its magical heat, becoming ordinary hair.

fiend_parts.name: Barbed Devil Spines
fiend_parts.failure_description: Sloppy removal causes the spines to shatter; the harvester takes 1d10 piercing damage from the jagged remains.

fiend_parts.name: Hellfire Heart
fiend_parts.failure_description: Explosive Failure: An ill-timed cut causes the heart to destabilize and explode. The harvester and all creatures within 15 feet take fire damage equal to the creature's CR in d10s.

fiend_parts.name: Pit Fiend Wing Leather
fiend_parts.failure_description: The hide is torn during the skinning process, resulting in 'sloppy' materials; any armor crafted from this leather suffers a -1 penalty to its AC modifier.

fiend_parts.name: Imp Tail Barb
fiend_parts.failure_description: The poison gland is punctured, draining the barb of its toxic potency and exposing the harvester to the imp's poison.

plant_parts.name: Paralytic Spores
plant_parts.failure_description: Hazard: The harvester accidentally inhales the spores and must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute [4, 5].

plant_parts.name: Heartwood
plant_parts.failure_description: Sloppy materials: The wood is splintered, resulting in a -1 penalty to the AC or attack modifier of the final crafted item [6, 7].

plant_parts.name: Wind Spores
plant_parts.failure_description: The spores are released prematurely, granting 1 hour of non-breathing to the harvester but destroying the harvestable sample [8].

plant_parts.name: Ruby Morel
plant_parts.failure_description: The delicate brain-like structure is bruised, losing the potency required to create an elixir of health [9, 10].

plant_parts.name: Blight Ichor
plant_parts.failure_description: The ichor is contaminated, causing the harvester to suffer the effects of a confusion spell for 1 minute [11].

aberration_parts.name: Aboleth Mucus (Flask)
aberration_parts.notes: If kept in a sealed container, this can be used to coat a weapon. On a hit, the target must succeed on a CON save or lose the ability to breathe air for 1d4 hours.
aberration_parts.failure_description: The mucus dries out and loses its potency, becoming useless.

aberration_parts.name: Beholder Eye-Stalk Retina
aberration_parts.notes: Can be processed by an alchemist into a Potion of True Seeing or a one-time use scroll of Ray of Enfeeblement.
aberration_parts.failure_description: The delicate retina is damaged during extraction, rendering it useless.

aberration_parts.name: Mind Flayer Brain-Stem
aberration_parts.notes: When dried and ground into a powder, it acts as a powerful component for psychic spells, increasing the DC by 1.
aberration_parts.failure_description: The brain-stem is damaged during extraction, losing its psionic properties.

beast_parts.name: Winter Wolf Vocal Chords
beast_parts.notes: Can be fashioned into a whistle that, when blown, mimics the terrifying howl of the pack, forcing a DC 12 WIS save against the Frightened condition.
beast_parts.failure_description: The vocal chords are damaged during extraction, unable to produce the proper sound.

beast_parts.name: Giant Spider Spinneret
beast_parts.notes: Can be harvested intact to create 50 feet of "Silk Rope" that is nearly invisible (+5 to DC to spot) and has double the hit points of standard rope.
beast_parts.failure_description: The spinneret is damaged, producing only half the normal amount of silk.

beast_parts.name: Crag Cat Hide
beast_parts.notes: Naturally reflects some magic; can be used to craft Bracers of Defense that specifically provide advantage on saves against Magic Missile.
beast_parts.failure_description: The hide is damaged during skinning, losing some of its magical reflective properties.

monstrosity_parts.name: Basilisk Eye-Lens
monstrosity_parts.notes: If harvested without cracking, it can be polished into "Petrifying Spectacles." Looking through them gives you a +2 to Investigation, but you have a 5% chance of accidentally petrifying yourself for 1 round on a natural 1.
monstrosity_parts.failure_description: The lenses crack during extraction, losing their petrifying properties.

monstrosity_parts.name: Displacer Beast Tendon
monstrosity_parts.notes: Highly elastic and magically "shifty." Makes for a superior bowstring that adds +10 feet to the weapon's long range.
monstrosity_parts.failure_description: The tendon loses its magical elasticity, becoming no better than a normal bowstring.

monstrosity_parts.name: Hydra Gallbladder
monstrosity_parts.notes: Extremely potent bile. Can be used as a powerful acid that ignores the damage threshold of non-magical objects.
monstrosity_parts.failure_description: The gallbladder ruptures, spilling its contents and dealing acid damage to the harvester.

ooze_parts.name: Black Pudding Residue
ooze_parts.notes: A corrosive sludge that, when applied to a lock, dissolves it in 1d4 rounds (though it makes a lot of noise and smoke).
ooze_parts.failure_description: The residue dries out, losing its corrosive properties.
ooze_parts.special_notes: Makes a loud sizzling noise and produces thick smoke when used.
